titles.title: Glorious Things Of Thee Are Spoken (hymn of th

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Glorious things of thee are spoken Zion city of our God He whose word cannot be broken Formed thee for His own abode On the Rock of Ages founded What can shake thy sure repose With salvation's walls surrounded Thou may'st smile at all thy foes{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: {lang-eng}See the streams of living waters Springing from eternal love Well supply thy sons and daughters And all fear of want remove Who can faint while such a river Ever flows their thirst t'assuage Grace which like the Lord the Giver Never fails from age to age{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Blest inhabitants of Zion Washed in the Redeemer's blood Jesus whom their souls rely on Makes them kings and priests to God 'Tis His love His people raises Over self to reign as kings And as priests His solemn praises Each his thankful offering brings{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Savior since of Zion's city I thro' grace a member am Let the world deride or pity I will glory in Thy name Fading is the worldling's pleasure All its boasted pomp and show Solid joys and lasting treasures None but Zion's children know{/lang-eng}
